issuetype.name: Bug

fixVersions.description: Dynamic Reconfig, Remove Watches, Local Session

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

components.name: c client
components.description: The c client interface to ZooKeeper

fields.description: If the client is connected to a zookeeper server that has hung while there is an outstanding request, zookeeper_interest() can return a timeval of 0 because send_to will be negative.
fields.summary: zookeeper_interest() in C client can return a timeval of 0

comments.body: Ensures that send_to is not set to be negative in zookeeper_interest().

I tried to attach a patch, but I couldn't figure out how to do it, so here is a link to it:

https://gist.github.com/eric/6481934
Fix for the issue.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12602032/zookeeper-3.4.5-send_to-fix.patch
  against trunk revision 1520436.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.

Hi Eric, you can use git however you need to use "git diff --no-prefix" to generate it. Our automation uses regular "patch -p0 < file.patch" to apply the changes and test them. Give that a try. thanks.

This message is automatically generated.
How do I change what branch it's applied to?
Please let me know what I need to do to get this accepted.

Hi [~lindvall] when you submit patches they are always applied to trunk by the patchbot. The best way to address this is to submit a patch to trunk, and a separate patch to any other branches if necessary (if the trunk patch doesn't apply cleanly to the branch). Always submit the trunk related patch last as that is the one that the patchbot will apply/test against trunk code.

Also you need to use patch/svn diff semantics "git diff --no-prefix" or "svn diff" as appropriate.

We typically name things ZOOKEEPER-####.patch to keep committers from losing their marbles any further. ;-) (see https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/ZOOKEEPER/HowToContribute)

Thanks!

Okay. I'll check it out when I have some time (I'm not sure when I'll have a chance to get to it).

The issue isn't a blocker for me, because I'm applying this patch as part of the build process of the zookeeper gem, but for anyone else using the C client, it's going to likely make a difference for how well they handle server timeouts (it's made a huge difference in production for me).
ZOOKEEPER-1756.patch and br34 supersede previous versions. trunk and branch34 respectively.

NP. [~lindvall] is it possible to add a test for this problem/change?

The only way I was able to repro it was with a test-harness I wrote to replication network failures, and only was able to identify the problem by an excess of log messages.

Here's the code I had used:
https://github.com/zk-ruby/zookeeper/blob/master/zoomonkey/zoomonkey.rb
[~michim] any chance you could review this for commit? You're more up-to-date with the c client than I am.
Sure I'll take a look.
+1 Thank you for the patch Eric.
